meanings.definition: In a towering manner; very tall or high.
meanings.sent1: The giraffe stood toweringly above the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper rose toweringly into the sky, casting a shadow over the city streets.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten tried to climb the toweringly high bookshelf, thinking it was a tree.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak loomed toweringly in the distance, challenging the climbers.
meanings.sent5: The giant redwood tree stood toweringly in the forest, its branches reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: To a very great degree; extremely.
meanings.sent1: She toweringly excelled in her math class, always getting top scores on every test.
meanings.sent2: The singer toweringly belted out the high notes, impressing the audience with her vocal range.
meanings.sent3: The chef toweringly seasoned the dish with a pinch of salt, making it too salty to eat.
meanings.sent4: His anger toweringly flared up when he discovered the broken vase on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The storm toweringly raged outside, with thunder shaking the windows and lightning illuminating the sky.
